decks.notes: This deck revolves around using cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to quickly tutor for and play powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck also utilizes Nourishing Shoal and Pact of Negation to protect its combo pieces and ensure a successful game plan. By efficiently ramping and tutoring for key cards, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with high-impact creatures and powerful abilities while disrupting their game plan with cards like Veil of Summer and Endurance.

The deck focuses on cycling through cards quickly to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By cycling through cards like Street Wraith and Curator of Mysteries, the player can quickly fill up their graveyard and then cast Living End to reanimate a board full of powerful creatures. Force of Negation and Subtlety provide disruption against opposing spells, while Endurance can be used to exile key cards from the opponent's graveyard. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence while controlling the game with counter spells and disruptive creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly putting out artifact creatures and using various spells and abilities to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The key strategy is to quickly build up a board presence using mana-efficient artifacts and creatures, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. By efficiently utilizing artifacts and synergies within the deck, this Aggro - Affinity archetype aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful land combo using Amulet of Vigor to ramp up mana quickly. By utilizing cards like Primeval Titan, Scapeshift, and Explore, the goal is to search for specific land cards like Lotus Field and Urza's Saga to generate a massive amount of mana and overwhelming board presence. The deck aims to quickly set up a win condition by tutoring the necessary lands and utilizing the synergy between the various land cards to create a dominant board state.

The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and powerful removal spells, while also utilizing Leyline of the Guildpact to make its multicolored creatures more difficult to deal with. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provides early aggression, while Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer potent late-game threats. The deck also includes a selection of lands and spells to ensure consistent mana production and disruption against the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. It also includes cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies to control the board and maintain board advantage. The deck also has tools like Consign to Memory and Quantum Riddler for card advantage and selection. Overall, the deck aims to be a versatile and disruptive aggro deck that can adapt to different matchups.

This Aggro - Death and Taxes deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to control the board by utilizing cards like Solitude and Consign to Memory, while also using disruptive elements like Quantum Riddler and Prismatic Ending to slow down the opponent. Phelia and Phlage serve as powerful threats that can quickly end the game if left unchecked. Additionally, cards like Ragavan and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional value and card advantage to further push the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with cheap artifacts and efficient creatures, utilizing cards like Memnite and Kappa Cannoneer. It also includes artifact lands like Fiery Islet and Urza's Saga to power up cards like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Sink into Stupor, while also using cards like Thoughtcast to draw more resources. The deck can also close out the game quickly with cards like Pinnacle Emissary and Salvage Titan.

Utilizing the UrzaTron lands to assemble powerful mana ramp, this Control deck aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator while also presenting threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck uses a mix of removal, card advantage, and powerful finishers to control the game and overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere further amplify its disruption capabilities, making it a formidable force in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through rituals and medallions to cast key spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible. It uses Wrenn's Resolve to protect its combo pieces while digging through the deck with Reckless Impulse and Wish. The deck can also disrupt the opponent's hand with Highway Robbery and disrupt their board with Artist's Talent. By utilizing past in flames, the deck can recur key spells and continue the combo if disrupted. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with its explosive combo potential.

This deck utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines to control the game and out-value the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect its own threats, and ultimately win through incremental advantages and card advantage. The deck uses powerful planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler, as well as efficient removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to keep the opponent on the back foot. The goal is to grind out the opponent and win through attrition and incremental advantage.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a strong and aggressive creature base, backed up by burn spells and removal. Using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, along with powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent quickly. The inclusion of burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment allows the deck to deal direct damage and clear the way for its creatures to attack freely. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and proactive in its gameplay.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and using them to generate advantage, disrupt opponents, and power up creatures. It heavily utilizes artifact synergy and recursion with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Arcbound Ravager. By combining aggressive creatures like Kappa Cannoneer with strong artifact spells like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt, the deck aims to control the board while forcing the opponent to react to its threats. Cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble help to both power up the deck's strategy and provide card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, focusing on dealing continuous damage quickly. The deck utilizes synergies between its creatures and spells, with cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan providing early aggression, while cards like Phlage and Goblin Bombardment offer additional sources of damage. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah can help protect the creatures and provide a strong finisher. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to operate efficiently and apply pressure on the opponent.

The main strategy of this deck is to use artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a high amount of damage. By using cards like Urza's Saga to create powerful artifacts and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to recur key pieces from the graveyard, the deck can maintain a strong board presence and apply pressure early in the game. Additionally, cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke provide control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while continuing to push for a quick victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast and Lightning Skelemental to deal damage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier to enable powerful plays, the deck also include ways to recur creatures and push damage through with Leyline of Combustion and Flare of Malice. With a mix of aggressive threats and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive game plan.
